item.description:
Another good fall hike with our four legged friends...Mt Kearsarge.
Park at Winslow State Park, hiking distance 3 miles, approx hiking time 3 hours.
We'll be hiking the Barlow trail. Click here for a review of the trails

Again I have to say I have never done this hike before, I guess I really like to be surprised and ok...I like a bit of a challenge at times. I do not know what to expect and would welcome any feedback or advice from any members who have hiked this area. I think we'll need to pack a lunch and extra water and treats for our hardworking hiking friends.

DIRECTIONS

VIA TRAILHEADS AT WINSLOW STATE PARK:From exit 20 off I-93. Take Route 3 west towards Franklin. Go past downtown Tilton and downtown Franklin and make a right on 3A and then an immediate left on Route 11 towards Andover. Go past Andover and stay on Route 11 roughly 4 miles past the Andover. Make a left on Kearsarge Valley then follw signs to Winslow State Park (fee). The trails start at the end of the parking area. In winter the road to the parking area is closed. You have to hike up the road to the parking area.
item.how_to_find_us: Tan Chevy Tracker. "WOOF" sticker on back.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Mt. Kearsarge
